property.advert_heading: Grafton Walk, Off Ross Road, Hereford
property.main_advert:
A spacious and well presented four bedroom property just south of the River benefiting from central heating, double glazing, front and rear gardens with parking to the rear. Outlooks over a green to the front. Viewing advised.

Location: Located just to the South of the city with superb access to the city A49 Ross Road/Motorway.

Directions: Leave the city on A49 Ross Road turning right into Mayberry Ave. Viewers are invited to park in the parking area near to the green and proceed by foot to the property.

property.main_advert:
A four bedroom detached home located in the popular lower bullingham area. This well presented property benefits from a fabulous low-maintenance garden, ensuite shower, utility room, built-in wardrobes, and an integral garage with an internal entrance door. Direct route to the A49, and multiple car, bus, cycle, and foot routes in to Hereford City Centre.

Located in a quiet road in Lower Bullingham with easy access to the Wye Inn public house and multiple local shops.

Directions: Leave the city south-bound over the River Wye, follow the A49 towards Ross-On-Wye before turning left on to Holme Lacy Road. Follow Holme Lacy Road and then turn right on to St Clares Court (opposite The Wye In). At the end of the road you will reach a T junction, turn left on to Warwick Road.

property.main_advert:
A superbly presented and extended family home. Benefiting from recent modernisation including three reception rooms, large Kitchen with island, four bedrooms, En-Suite, family bathroom to the first floor, nice sized garden, and parking for several cars to the front. Viewing highly recommended!

Located in the popular residential area of Tupsley, with great local amenities and School catchments. A selection of shops, public houses and bus stops are nearby with the colleges being a short walk away.

Leave the City on Ledbury Road proceeding until turning left in to Whittern Way. Proceed until turning left in to Kentchurch Close and the property will be on the left.

property.main_advert: A beautifully presented two double bedroom home in the popular village of Withington. Offering modern and spacious accommodation with a downstairs WC, Kitchen, Lounge and Conservatory to the ground floor. Two double bedrooms with built-in wardrobes to the first floor with a bathroom. Viewings highly recommended on this property!
property.advert2: A beautifully presented two double bedroom home in the popular village of Withington. Offering modern and spacious accommodation with a downstairs WC, Kitchen, Lounge and Conservatory to the ground floor. Two double bedrooms with built-in wardrobes to the first floor with a bathroom. Viewings highly recommended on this property!
property.advert4: The sought after village of Withington lies just 5 miles north-east of Hereford and is situated in an attractive, semi-pastoral location offering a more rural-style of life, surrounded by the beautiful Herefordshire countryside, which is renowned for its apple orchards and hop fields. The area offers a superb variety of amenities and recreational facilities, and is well-placed and very accessible with excellent commuter links to the larger cities and nearby local towns
property.advert5: Head North on Commercial Road connecting to Aylestone Hill. Proceed to the mini roundabout taking the first exit, then 2nd exit then proceed down the hill taking the 3rd exit towards Worcester. Continue until reaching the Sign post for Withington, then turn off. Proceed until turning right at the shop, then right in to Meadow Close.

property.main_advert:
A well presented three bedroom property located in a sought after area North West of Hereford. Benefits include central heating, double glazing, a good sized kitchen, off road parking, garden with side access, and an outside storage area.

Location: Popular residential area of Whitecross, this property enjoys great local amenities, School Catchments, bus routes, convenience store and direct access to the City.

Directions: Travel westbound on the A438 WhiteCross Road until the Monument Roundabout, take the first exit. Then take the first left turn on to Marlow Drive before taking the third right turn on to Tennyson Close.

property.main_advert: A delightful detached period property in the rural village of Kilpeck. Full of characterful with countryside views, gardens and a detached garage. With an orchard and brookside garden believed to extend to approximately 1/4 of an acre in total. Formerly the village Inn and Smithy, this property is rich in period features yet having been sympathetically modernised to suit modern living. With four bedrooms and family bathroom to the first floor. The ground floor has an entrance hall, kitchen/dining room, living room, snug area and dining area with the added benefit of a downstairs cloakroom. Viewing comes highly recommended!
property.advert2: A delightful detached period property in the rural village of Kilpeck. Full of characterful with countryside views, gardens and a detached garage. With an orchard and brookside garden believed to extend to approximately 1/4 of an acre in total. Formerly the village Inn and Smithy, this property is rich in period features yet having been sympathetically modernised to suit modern living. With four bedrooms and family bathroom to the first floor. The ground floor has an entrance hall, kitchen/dining room, living room, snug area and dining area with the added benefit of a downstairs cloakroom. Viewing comes highly recommended!
property.advert5: rom Hereford, leave the City on the A465 from Belmont Road. Proceed for approximately 9 miles until turning right for Kilpeck (Kilpeck Church/Kilpeck Inn). Continue through the Village and turn right after passing the Pub. Proceed until crossing over a small stone bridge across the Brook. Just past the bridge, the property is located on the right hand side, with parking available on the left hand side as part of the property.

room.name: Exterior
room.description: A further covered area for storage or seating with an additional brick-built garden shed. The front garden is laid to grass with borders of mature shrubs, plants and trees. A pathway leads along the front of the house and curves towards the rear of the garden passing the storage areas. Panel fencing borders the road side with mature bushes to the other side. A pathway leads along the side of the property with hedging to border leading to a further pathway and gate. Proceeding in the the rear lawn which is laid to lawn with mature bushes and borders of hedging. The rear side of the property has a further lawn area where the oil tank is located for central heating. The Old Smithy offering additional parking together with a brick built garage with parking is located opposite the property.

property.main_advert:
Thinking Of Selling? Call For Our Superb Fee and Free Valuations.
A beautifully presented, dressed and kept four bedroom executive style detached house in Belmont. Offering 'more than meets the eye', this property boasts some exemplary fittings and finishes and offers a corner position within the cul-de-sac. A detached double garage and brick paved driveway with space for several vehicles. Finishes include Oak flooring and doors, Wool carpets and ceramic tiled floorings, a Jacuzzi bath, heated & illuminated mirrors, Air boost shower, Hydronic Kitchen heater as part of the central heating as well as a fully insulated, powered and networked cabin to the rear. A truly stunning example of one of the large detached four bedroom executive homes within the popular and well serviced area of Belmont. A short walk away, you can find not only Tesco but a doctor's surgery, pharmacy, parish hall and library

property.main_advert: An superb four bedroom detached house in Belmont. This property enjoys a great situation within this popular residential area. With views over a green to the front and a private rear garden. Furthermore, this property has been modernised, and altered internally to offer a stunning social 'hub of the home' with its open-plan living/kitchen/dining area. The addition of an en-suite to the master bedroom together with a downstairs WC, utility and double garage, makes this a fantastic family home. With Oak finishes, chrome fittings and Granite worktops this home is both modern and tastefully finished. Viewing highly recommended!

The room is spacious allowing space for a dining table and chairs, and three piece sofa suite. The two windows and sliding doors allow light to flood the room and the sliding doors lead out to a picturesque balcony, large enough for a small table and chairs which is ideal for alfresco dining and takes full advantage of the elevated views.

There is a small gravelled area surrounded by mature shrubs and a gate leading to steps down to the rear garden. The rear garden is enclosed by fencing and mature shrubs and is mainly laid to lawn. The garden is directly on the river side with wooden steps leading down to the water. A decked pathway provides access around the garden and a useful boat house underneath the property. There is also an elevated decked terrace area providing a brilliant space for outside entertaining and relaxing with the views of the river as a backdrop.

property.main_advert:
Please Note: Prospective buyers are required to be in a proceedable position with Cleared Funds and No Chain.
Fair House Farm is a detached two bedroom cottage dating back approx. 200 years. Extended over time with views across countryside from its lovely position on Garway Hill. The property, although in need of modernising also offers outbuildings, a large workshop and gardens with a separate small field of approx 0.5 acre. tbc (strictly for guidance only.) The house itself features a spacious kitchen/dining room, two reception rooms, two bedrooms and two bathrooms. With exposed wooden beams, stone walls and a large wood burner to the lounge. The property is of a split-level design with a ground floor bathroom, ground/first floor reception rooms and kitchen/dining room. The next split level offers a bathroom, then leads to the first floor offering the two double bedrooms and a large eaves storage area.
property.advert2:
Please Note: Prospective buyers are required to be in a proceedable position with No Chain.
Fair House Farm is a detached two bedroom cottage dating back approx. 200 years. Extended over time with views across countryside from its lovely position on Garway Hill. The property, although in need of modernising also offers outbuildings, a large workshop and gardens with a separate small field of approx 0.5 acre. tbc (strictly for guidance only.) The house itself features a spacious kitchen/dining room, two reception rooms, two bedrooms and two bathrooms. A characterful, period property with exposed wooden beams, stone walls and a large wood burner to the lounge. The property is of a split-level design with a ground floor bathroom, ground/first floor reception rooms and kitchen/dining room. The next split level offers a bathroom, then leads to the first floor offering the two double bedrooms and a large eaves storage area.
property.advert4: Located near to Garway Hill, this property enjoys some fine country views across Herefordshire. For the walkers, there are many public footpaths and routes to enjoy. Near to the Welsh Border and village of Pontillas, with Hereford and Ross-on-Wye being 15 miles and 12 miles away respectively.
property.advert5:
From Hereford, leave the City on Belmont Road to the A465. Proceed through Wormbridge. After passing the signs for Abbey Dore, turn left to Garway Hill. Follow the signs for Bagwyllydiart. Upon reaching Bagwyllydiart, proceed through the Hamlet and turn right just after a red post box on the right Signposted 'Garway Hill' . Bear left at the Chapel (pointer for sale board) and proceed past the methodist Church for a further 1km. Upon reaching a postbox with the name 'Stoggle', the property driveway is to the right. See map for exact pinpoint location.
Satnav: HR2 8RR will take you near to the property but will end about 500 metres away. See image . Look out for a pointer for sale board near the chapel and a board at the entrance to the property.
property.bullet5: Only Prospective Buyers With Cleared Funds Invited

property.advert_heading: Kings Acre Halt Mobile Home Park, Hereford
property.main_advert:
A spacious, well presented two bedroom and En-Suite park home at the popular Kings Acre Halt site. With double glazing, gas central heating (Calor Gas) Kitchen/Diner, lounge with patio door to raised decking with views to fields. Very well presented to the exterior and interior. We highly recommend an internal viewing! £132 ground rent.

Located at the Popular 'Kings Acre Halt' Park Home site, this property enjoys bus routes to the City, Wyevale Nurseries nearby, easy access to the North of the City and Hay-On-Wye and of course, all of the City's more comprehensive facilities.

Head West on Whitecross Road. At the roundabout, take the 2nd exit on to King Acre Road and proceed until passing Wyevale Garden Centre on the right hand side. Take the turning towards Credenhill on the right, then immediately turn left, just past the Car Sales Office in to Kings Acre Halt.

property.main_advert:
Walton Close is a semi-detached home which is both centrally heated and double glazed. A larger then average for a modern property garden extends to give access to the garage.
The property has an entrance hall with cloakroom off, an L shaped living room and overlooking the rear garden is the dining room and the kitchen. On the first floor there are three bedrooms and a bathroom. The property also has a driveway and garage. The rear garden area enjoys a south-westerly aspect. property.main_advert:

A perfect family home with four bedrooms, en-suite, downstairs WC, play room, two conservatories, garage, parking and its rear garden. Double glazed and centrally heated, this home must be viewed to be appreciated! An open design Kitchen and dining room with finishes of Oak throughout the property. A further benefit is the solar array this property has which is owned and the vendors express a current income of £125 p/m .
The gardens are a particular feature and viewing is highly advised.

property.advert_heading: St Clares Court, Lower Bullingham , HR2 6PX
property.main_advert: A detached four bedroom house with conservatory, located on the southern edge of the City in St Clares Court. A well presented family home with an enclosed rear garden, garage, parking and downstairs WC. Double glazed and centrally heated with a modern kitchen and bathroom. En-Suite to the master bedroom. Viewing recommended.
property.advert2: A detached four bedroom house with conservatory, located on the southern edge of the City in St Clares Court. A well presented family home with an enclosed rear garden, garage, parking and downstairs WC. Double glazed and centrally heated with a modern kitchen and bathroom. En-Suite to the master bedroom. Viewing recommended.
property.advert4: Located in the popular residential area of Lower Bullingham, this property enjoys local parks, a public house, great access to the City and the North of Hereford and Ross-on-Wye.
property.advert5: Head South on Ross Road. At the lights, turn left on to Holme Lacy Road and proceed over the mini-roundabout and continue until reaching the Wye Inn on the left. The entrance to St Clares Court is on the right hand side. Take the first left towards the property.

property.main_advert:
A modern, very well presented three bedroom semi-detached house in this popular residential location. Centrally heated and double glazed with an additional porch. Garage and driveway to the rear. Further benefits include a downstairs WC, spacious kitchen and large living area with a modern family bathroom to the first floor. Viewings come highly recommended!

Located to the North West of the City, this property enjoys an outlook to Green to the front and has great city access with local amenities and bus routes to the City.

Head West on Whitecross Road and take the 4th exit at the roundabout on to Yazor Road. Proceed until turning left in to Windemere Road and Coniston Walk is to your right hand side.

property.main_advert:
A lovely three bedroom semi detached traditional property located on the edge of this very popular village. Benefits include two good sized reception rooms, traditional features such as picture rails and stair case , double glazing and gardens. Williams are informed the property is available with NO CHAIN.

Location: Ewyas Harold is located in South West Herefordshire and is set in glorious surrounding countryside between the centres of Hereford and Abergavenny and to the East of the Black Mountains. Ewyas Harold is sought as it is one of a few Herefordshire villages that offer a range of amenities including a primary school, church, public house, village store, butchers, doctors and veterinary practice. Hereford and Abergavenny offer a full range of amenities and facilities together with railway and bus stations.

Directions: From central Hereford proceed south west on the A465 and after approximately 10 miles take the right hand turn into Ewyas Harold. At the Ewyas Harold sign take the very next left onto a shared driveway before the lampost to the property on your left.

property.main_advert:
A superb three bedroom semi detached located in a cul de sac position with panoramic views of Herefordshire.
From the first floor, views span to Hereford Cathedral , Dinedor, Callow, The Water Tower and on towards the Black Mountains.
The property is very well presented and has been updated throughout to offer a downstairs Wc, modern kitchen with filter water system, integrated cooker and hob, a conservatory, bathroom with separate shower cubicle and jacuzzi style bath, driveway and lovely garden with Hereford Race Course to the rear.
Other benefits include central heating with Nest system and double glazing throughout the property.
The property is offered with No Chain and an internal viewing is highly recommended.
Watch the available video for a good first impression.

property.main_advert:
This superb, spacious detached residence occupies a prime location in a small residential cul-de-sac off Roman Road on the Northern outskirts of Hereford. The property is situated in a well established locality with easy access to a wide range of local amenities including local stores, bus service, inn and schools. Built to an individual design in approx 1957, the property has been substantially enlarged and extended in recent years to provide a spacious family-sized home. The property has the benefit of replacement double-glazed windows, gas-fired central heating and extensive refurbishment has been carried out by the present owners including replacement bathroom and kitchen fittings. The property includes a lounge with adjoining study area, dining room, kitchen, utility, large family room with access to conservatory, sewing room and wet room. There are 3 good-sized bedrooms and in addition to the garage, there is ample parking for up to 4 cars.
Directions: From Grey Friars Bridge in Hereford City centre proceed North and at the major roundabout take the first exit into Edgar Street. On reaching the mini-roundabout take the first exit left into Newtown Road and at the next mini-roundabout take the second exit right into Holmer Road. On reaching the major roundabout by the Starting Gate Inn, take the first exit left into Roman Road and Belle Bank Avenue is the first turning to be found on the right hand side. Turn right into the first cul-de-sac and Pantiles will be found a short way along on the right hand side.

room.name: Exterior
room.description: There is a brick pavier approach driveway with adjoining gravel hard-standing providing ample parking space for 3/4 cars, and access to the integral garage, with remote control roller shutter door, light, power, double-glazed side window and personal rear-access door. External lighting. Garden tap. Garden shed. The gardens are beautifully laid out and are an outstanding feature of the property. The front garden is fully enclosed and is down to paving with gravel walk ways, for ease of maintenance, with a number of ornamental trees and bushes including Photinia and Silver Birch. To the side of the garage there is a useful storage area. A side entrance gate leads to the rear garden which has a wide paved patio enclosed by paling fence and providing an ideal dog run. The main garden is laid to lawn with adjoining flower beds. There is a large gravel play area presently housing above ground swimming pool 24’ x 12' which is not included in the sale but could be acquired by separate negotiation. Beyond the garden there is a separate enclosure with a workshop.

Directions: Leave the city north-bound via the A49 until you reach the Starting Gate roundabout, take the first exit on to the A4103 Roman Road. Continue until the left-hand turn on to Kempton Avenue. Take the third left on to Sandown Drive, before taking the first right on to Cheltenham Avenue.

A two DOUBLE bedroom terraced house in Saxongate offered on low cost ownership of 70% market value.. Benefiting from double glazing, central heating, enclosed rear garden, downstairs WC and ample storage. There is a car port and off-road parking to the front of the property. Offered with no onward chain.

Located to the south of the city with excellent access to Ross On Wye and the motorway networks.

Head South on Ross Road. Turn left in to Bullingham Lane, then left again in to Waggoners Way. Take the 2nd right in to Smithy court then bear left to the property.

No additional rent to pay. Amelia Howes - Homepoint. for applications call: 01432 261894

property.main_advert:
A three bedroom detached bungalow in need of modernisation located in the sought after village of Marden. The property benefits from double glazing and gas central heating throughout, front and rear gardens, garage and off road parking, ample storage throughout, and a great cul-de-sac location.

Location: Located in the north-Herefordshire village of Marden. Also within the village are the post office, primary school, shops, hairdressers, and a church. In addition to this, the location of this home also leads itself to easy access to the A49, bus stops, and multiple country walks.

Directions: Leave Hereford via Aylestone Hill, taking the second exit at the roundabout at the bottom of the hill leading to Sutton St Nicholas. As you enter Sutton St Nicholas, take the left turn at the cross roads at the Golden Cross public house towards Marden. Follow the road to Marden village. Whilst passing through Marden village, you will find Little Paradise signposted on the left.

property.advert_heading: St Owens Court, Mill Street, Hereford
property.main_advert:
Retirement accommodation for over 55's, within close proximity to Hereford City Centre. A well presented and spacious one bedroom 2nd(top) floor corner apartment with no onward chain. The property comprises of entrance hall with airing cupboard, a good sized double bedroom ,well-appointed bathroom, spacious lounge and modern kitchen. Outside the property has a communal car park providing off road car parking, bin store. £366 per quarter maintenance/service charge. 99 year lease, expiring 24th March 2084. (63 years remaining approx)

Located near to the City centre, this property enjoy all of its comprehensive facilities. Together with being located near to the Castle Green, Bishops Meadows and Hereford Duck Pond, this property has lots of outside spaces which can be enjoyed via shorts walks.

Proceed from Hereford city centre along St Owens Street and the property is located on the right hand side.

property.main_advert:
A beautifully presented Three / Four bedroom detached cottage in Stretton Sugwas, situated in the rural North-West outskirts of Hereford. The property benefits from a gorgeous country outlook, off-road parking, triple glazing to the rear aspect and double glazing to the sides and frontage, gas central heating. Viewing is strongly recommended!

Location: Located in Stretton Sugwas, a village to the North-West of Hereford. The location grants direct access to Hereford City and the A49 via the Roman Road. This also lends itself to accessing pubs, shops, schools, and other amenities in the vicinity.

Directions: Leave Hereford Westbound via the Roman Road, following the road past the market towards the roundabout. At the roundabout, take the second exit straight over towards Stretton Sugwas before taking the second left-hand turn towards the property.

SALE AGREED-MORE REQUIRED FOR WAITING BUYERS A spacious first/ top floor, two bedroom apartment located to the South West of Hereford city. With character features, the property benefits from a garden, sash windows, rural outlook, garage, electric heating and plentiful storage.
Information: Lease recently renewed to approx.154 years. £100 per annum ground rent. Shared Septic Tank.
Directions: Leave Hereford on Belmont Road turning right for Clehonger and then left for Kingstone. Proceed past Kingstone School and at the junction turn right on to the B4348. Proceed, passing a turning for Kerrys Gate ( also access from this direction). At The Croft, turn left for Bacton and Abbeydore onto the B4347. Proceed passing Gwatkin Cider on your right. Turn left for Kerrys Gate and on the sharp left bend ( See a yellow hydrant) turn right into Riverdale. ( If you pass Black Bush Farm you have not turned right on the bend)

A two bedroom end-terrace house with front and rear garden, lovely panoramic views towards Lugwardine, side access and two parking spaces. A great first time purchase or investment. Offering a nicely presented home with central heating, double glazing, recently fitted modern kitchen and a delightful rear garden. FREEHOLD. Council Tax: B
Location: Located in the popular village of Withington, just a few miles North East of Hereford. With bus routes to Hereford City and Bromyard Town. Local amenities include a village shop, Post office, Village hall, Primary School, Nursery school and Church. With easy access to Worcester, Ledbury and Bromyard.
Directions: Head North on Commerical Road connecting to Aylestone Hill. Proceed to the roundabout taking the 3rd exit towards Worcester. Continue past the Bromyard turning until reaching the 2nd Sign post for Withington, then turn left near to the new development. Proceed until reaching South Bank on the right hand side. On arriving in Southbank bear right.

property.main_advert:
SALE AGREED - MORE REQUIRED FOR WAITING BUYERS.

Set In the Popular Rural Village of Bodenham, a superbly presented and renovated three bedroom detached bungalow. The property benefits from recently fitted kitchen, bathroom with additional walk in shower, feature wooden flooring, lovely rear gardens, oil central heating, double glazing and a garage. An internal inspection comes highly recommended from the vendors selling agent.

Location - Brockington Road is situated in the popular North Herefordshire Village of Bodenham. The Village itself has an excellent range of amenities including the England's Gate Public House, Post Office, popular Primary School, Garage and General Stores, Church, Village Hall, Doctor's Surgery and thriving local community. The market town of Leominster is close to hand for a good range of facilities including Train Station, with the larger Cathedral City of Hereford has a more extensive range of amenities.

Directions - From Leominster, approaching Bodenham on the A417, turn right opposite the village hall, down past Englands Gate Pub on your right and turn immediate right after the pub and take the first left which will take you into Brockington Road and the property can be found on your left.

From Hereford leave the city East over Ayelstone Hill and onto Sutton St Nicholas. Proceed until arriving in Bodenham.

property.main_advert:
Retirement accommodation for over 55's, within close proximity to Hereford City Centre. A well presented one bedroom ground floor apartment with no onward chain. The property comprises of entrance hall with airing cupboard, bedroom, well-appointed shower room, spacious lounge, and modern kitchen. Outside the property has a communal car park providing off road car parking, bin store. Lease length approximately 66 years (to be confirm by solicitor upon successful offer).

Located near to the City centre, this property enjoy all of its comprehensive facilities. Together with being located near to the Castle Green, Bishops Meadows and Hereford Duck Pond, this property has lots of outside spaces which can be enjoyed via shorts walks.
£366 per quarter maintenance/service charge. 99 year lease, expiring 24th March 2084. (63 years remaining approx)
Proceed from Hereford city centre along St Owens Street and the property is located on the right hand side.

property.main_advert:
Parkfields is situated in the parish of Weston-under-Penyard approximately 3 miles to the south east
of the market town of Ross-on-Wye. Parkfields is 4.7 miles to the M50 roundabout in the south west
of centre of Pontshill within the Castle Brook Valley surrounded by farmland to the south and
woodland to the north.

Parkfields is a beautiful country house with ancillary buildings that has a mention all the way back to
the Doomsday book. Fully renovated in 1995 this property has been fastidiously maintained by the
current owners.

With 8 Bedrooms in the main house, a further 11 in the stables (formerly 4 flats) and the potential
for 4 further bedrooms in Granary and an attached three bedroom cottage - available by separate
negotiation.] There is an enormous amount of potential.

The bright and light Garden Room can seat up to 91 for a wedding breakfast - but would also make
an ideal yoga studio. The main dining room (Castle brook room) can seat up to 50 but is equally cosy
with just a handful of friends.

The Coach house and surrounding storage and office rooms (formerly an art gallery and artist
studios), could be let out to individual artists, crafts, small business office spaces.

Outside there are 10 acres to explore. 2 acres of formal gardens around a lake and mill stream with
amazing redwoods, beech, poplars, London plane trees, and a further eight acres of fields, fruit trees
and woodland for a variety of uses.

Parkfields is best appreciated by viewing.

A versatile property with many potential uses including Airbnb and holiday lets. For the last 28 years
Parkfields Country House has been used as an exclusive hire venue for weddings, conferences and
team building courses. In the recent past the ceremony room was used as an art gallery with
ancillary studios, a farm house, and after WWII was a respite care home.





Millbrook House and The Granary - Additional Property - Available by Separate Negotiation:
There is an additional 3 bedroom stone cottage with a detached Granary with four additional letting
bedrooms and a studio/office meeting room.

SALE AGREED!! SIMILAR PROPERTY REQUIRED FOR WAITING BUYERS.
Located in this very sought after area of the city, is this three bedroom semi detached house. The property benefits from gas fired heating, a downstairs Wc , utility room, downstairs shower room, a garage and lovely views from the main bedroom.
Location: Located to the North East of the city, with excellent access to both primary and secondary schooling and local amenities.
Directions: On leaving the city on Ledbury Road turn right just after the Tesco store into Lichfield Avenue. Bear right and the property is along to your left hand side.

property.main_advert:
A spacious three bedroom detached bungalow in the desirable village of Lugwardine. This property benefits from a Garage, off-road parking, front and rear gardens, Dining Room, Utility area, WC, and double glazing with central heating. NO CHAIN

Location: In the popular village of Lugwardine, this property enjoys excellent school catchments, bus routes, village store, church, community hall, playing field, public house, country walks and fishing with easy access to the city’s more comprehensive facilities.

Directions: Proceed toward Lugwardine from Hereford on the A438. Turn left on to Traherne Close shortly before the school before following a left corner. The property is on the left.

property.advert_heading: Fayre Oaks Home Park, Kings Acre Road, Hereford
property.main_advert:
A spacious and very well presented two bedroom detached park home located on this popular residential site. The property benefits from double glazing, mains gas central heating, two bedrooms, a good sized modern kitchen, dining area and full width lounge, shower room with double shower cubicle, bricked base, off-road parking, and garden.

Age: Approximately 4 years
Ground Rent: Approximately £160pcm

Location: Located in the popular Kings Acre Area to the North West of Hereford city with excellent local amenities.

Directions: Leave the city West on Whitecross Road proceeding over the monument roundabout into Kings Acre Road. Pass the Post Office and turn left into the Fayre Oaks Park. Proceed to Eastern Avenue on the left. The property will be found on the left.
property.advert2:

Age: Approximately 4 years

Location: Located in the popular Kings Acre Area to the North West of Hereford city with excellent local amenities.

property.advert_heading: Watkins Court, Old Mill Close, Hereford
property.main_advert:
A well presented one bedroom second floor retirement apartment situated within the delightful retirement complex of Watkins Court. Benefits include double glazing, well maintained communal gardens and off road parking. The apartment also offers additional facilities for residents to include communal living room, house manager, laundry room and elevator access.

Lease Length: 107 Years (TBC by solicitor).
Ground Rent: Approximately £365 Per Annum (TBC by solicitor)
Service Charge: Approximately £2,300 Per Annum (TBC by solicitor)

Location: The property is located a short distance from the City's more comprehensive facilities all nearby.

Directions: At the junction before crossing Greyfriars Bridge (Southbound) take the right before turning right into Friars Street immediately after The Church of St Nicholas and continue along this road before entering Old Mill Close which will be signposted on your left.

One of the recently built stylish four bedroom semi-detached townhouse style homes in South Hereford. With modern finishes, En-Suite, Downstairs Cloakroom and all being very well presented with a nice rear garden with parking to the side, this property makes a great home. Viewing Highly Recommended.

Located off Belmont Road, this property enjoys great local amenities, Bus Routes, Fast Food store and Supermarkets within walking distance and of course, the Citys more comprehensive facilities.

Head South on Belmont Road proceeding until turning left just past the bridge. Follow the road past the newly Urbanised area with amenities with Subway on the left and proceed until reaching the property as denoted by our For Sale board.

A spacious extended four bedroom semi detached house located in this sought after location. The property benefits from central heating with a modern Worcester boiler, double glazing, garage with off-road parking, En-Suite WC, Conservatory, and a fantastic position in close proximity to the quarry. The rear garden also features patio, lawn, and a garden shed

Location: Located to the North East of the city in the popular Tupsley area. Local amenities are plentiful with access to popular schooling for all age groups. Direct access to the Quarry and City Centre.

Directions: Leave the city East on Ledbury Road proceeding until taking the third exit on to Hafod Road at the roundabout (shortly before The Rose & Crown). Turn left on to Eign Hill at the end of Hafod Road before taking two left turns in quick succession on to Quarry Road. The property is on the right.

property.main_advert:
A four bedroom Townhouse in a popular North-Hereford residential location. This property benefits from En-Suite, WC, Utility, full double glazing and central heating, garage, and off-road parking.

Location: Located on the popular Kernal Road in Whitecross, the property enjoys short walks to the City Centre and access to all of the cities more comprehensive facilities.

Directions: Leave the City West on Whitecross Road proceeding over the X junction. Take the next left in to Ryelands Street. At the micro roundabout, take the first exit on to Kernal Road.

property.main_advert:
A three bedroom detached bungalow in need of modernisation located in the sought-after location of rural North-Herefordshire. The property benefits from double glazing, generously sized plot, garage and off road parking, large Conservatory, Utility Room, Dining Room, and a fantastic countryside location. OFFERED WITH NO-ONWARD CHAIN!
Please Note to Watch the video of gardens for guide.
Located in the North Herefordshire parish of Avenbury. Lending itself direct access to country walks in addition to route to Hereford City and Bromyard Town.

When Travelling on the A4103, turn off towards Bishops Frome. Follow the B214 Northbound before reaching a right hand turn to Church Road. Upon taking the turn, the property is situated on the left.
property.advert2: A three bedroom detached bungalow in need of modernisation located in the delightful parish of Avenbury. The property benefits from double glazing, generously sized plot, garage and off road parking, large Conservatory, Utility Room, Dining Room, and a fantastic countryside location.

property.main_advert:
Parkfields is situated in the parish of Weston-under-Penyard approximately 3 miles to the south east
of the market town of Ross-on-Wye. Parkfields is 4.7 miles to the M50 roundabout in the south west
of centre of Pontshill within the Castle Brook Valley surrounded by farmland to the south and
woodland to the north.

Parkfields is a beautiful country house with ancillary buildings that has a mention all the way back to
the Doomsday book. Fully renovated in 1995 this property has been fastidiously maintained by the
current owners.

With 8 Bedrooms in the main house, a further 11 in the stables (formerly 4 flats) and the potential
for 4 further bedrooms in Granary and an attached three bedroom cottage - available by separate
negotiation.] There is an enormous amount of potential.

The bright and light Garden Room can seat up to 91 for a wedding breakfast - but would also make
an ideal yoga studio. The main dining room (Castle brook room) can seat up to 50 but is equally cosy
with just a handful of friends.

The Coach house and surrounding storage and office rooms (formerly an art gallery and artist
studios), could be let out to individual artists, crafts, small business office spaces.

Outside there are 10 acres to explore. 2 acres of formal gardens around a lake and mill stream with
amazing redwoods, beech, poplars, London plane trees, and a further eight acres of fields, fruit trees
and woodland for a variety of uses.

Parkfields is best appreciated by viewing.

A versatile property with many potential uses including Airbnb and holiday lets. For the last 28 years
Parkfields Country House has been used as an exclusive hire venue for weddings, conferences and
team building courses. In the recent past the ceremony room was used as an art gallery with
ancillary studios, a farm house, and after WWII was a respite care home.





Millbrook House and The Granary - Additional Property - Available by Separate Negotiation:
There is an additional 3 bedroom stone cottage with a detached Granary with four additional letting
bedrooms and a studio/office meeting room.
